TextView.android:text: Hepatitis A is a liver infection caused by the Hepatitis A virus (HAV). It infects liver cells and causes inflammation. The inflammation can impair liver function and cause other signs and symptoms of hepatitis B. Doctors recommend that children should get 2 doses of the hepatitis A shot for best protection. They should get the first dose at 12 through 23 months. They will need the second dose 6 to 18 months after the first.
